comment.author: 15395914@N00
comment._content: I can positively say that this is not Hedalen Stave Church from Sør-Aurdal county. I grew up on the farm next to that church and I was a guide in it for tourist while I was in school. They restored it in 1902, but didn't do big changes. You can also see that the front has not been built the way a stave church is constructed. Here is a picture of how Hedalen Stave Church really looks, December 2010:

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
MadeByKjartan: Looking at your own photograph, I'm convinced you're right. This can't be Hedalen Stave Chuch. Thanks a lot for giving us this information and for posting your own photo to compare with. :)

It would be just great if you our someone else could help us identify the church on our photo! 

/Anna B.

comment.author: 48743147@N00
comment._content: Could this be Lom Stave Church? no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lom_stavkirke

comment.author: 30236399@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/paaols] Don´t think so. Take a look here www.snl.no/.bilde/Lom_stavkirke_%E2%80%93_1 and notice the four small spires sourounding the large spire.

comment.author: 48743147@N00
comment._content: Ah, you're probably right about that. I'll keep digging!

comment.author: 14880037@N02
comment._content: It is a Viking space ship that has been waiting a thousand years for someone to refuel it.

comment.author: 28303254@N05
comment._content: very similar to  Venabygd, which is not a stave but a cross church (korskirke)

comment.author: 28303254@N05
comment._content: Biri and Fåvang also have korskirker that are very similar

comment.author: 28303254@N05
comment._content: disregard the "not a ... but a... " remark,  one does of course not exclude the other

comment.author: 59056321@N04
comment._content: probably Heidal . And it is not a stave church. I think the farm you can see in the background in Heringstad.

comment.author: 55069477@N00
comment._content: I would guess it's Heidal church. no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heidal_kirke A lot of differences, but the roof on top is the same, as is the main structure. But a lot of windows have changed and so have the entrances. I then checked Digitalt musum, and found the answer at this photo from 1927: digitaltmuseum.no/things/heidal-kirke-sel/NF/NF.08207-106... :-)

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content: Thank you all for your efforts to identify, and thanks martinrund for sharing your interesting theory! :-) RolfSteinar: I think the old photo you found from Norsk Folkemuseum clarifies perfectly that this is Heidal church. Thanks a lot for helping us find the correct information! DigitaltMuseum is really a great resource to search for objects from museum collections. Here's another photo of Heidal church: www.digitaltmuseum.no/things/kirkebygning/NF/NF.01577-008... /Anna B.

comment.author: 15395914@N00
comment._content: For the record: Heidal and Hedal (often called Hedalen) are two different places. Heidal is in Gudbrandsdalen, Oppland county and Hedal(en) is situated in Sør-Aurdal/Valdres in the same Oppland county.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
MadeByKjartan: Thank you for clarifying about Heidal and Hedal. And I've now added "Gudbrandsdalen" to the photo data, thanks to your remark.   
/Anna B.
